metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3510 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ssl3_send_client_key_exchange function in s3_clnt.c in OpenSSL 0.9.8before 0.9.8zb, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0n, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1i allows remoteDTLS servers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference andclient application crash) via a crafted handshake message in conjunctionwith a (1) anonymous DH or (2) anonymous ECDH ciphersuite.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3510` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
